hopobject.name: Page
hopobject.body: Whereabouts in are you from? nexgenpharmaceuticals.com review Daniel Collins’s soda loaf is more of a brick. “I started making soda bread because the method is so easy, but every loaf is heavy and airless. I have made three, and thrown them all away. Shall I give up?” No, don’t, help is at hand from the experts. I learnt to make soda loaves from the Allens of Ballymaloe, who have a hotel and cookery school in Co Cork. They have published many soda bread recipes in their books, most recently in the excellent Master It by Darina Allen’s brother, Rory O’Connell. From his advice, it appears you are overmixing. He says just mix and shape the dough quickly – “Kneading the dough is unnecessary and will actually toughen the bread,” he writes. Keep trying.
